column4: hey guys I was in yesterday trying to fix my problem of installing zsnes but I ran out of time, anyone around that could help me? for some reason when I try and install using the command sudo apt-get install zsnes it tells me that zsnes has no installation candidate
using hardy?  sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get install zsnes
wait wait
I actually used sudo apt-get install upgrade
check your software sources via system->administration and make sure "universe" repositories are enabled
k one sec
they are all enabled
in that case, you should have it in your repos... it's part of universe... if you can't get it via apt, you can download the .deb via http://packages.ubuntu.com
well I downloaded a file from the zsnes website but it is a bz2 file any idea how to install it that way?
it is .tar.bz2 if that helps any
or would it just be better to get it from the package ubuntu website
you don't have to compile... CZ-18 is a fudspreader ;)  though i agree that apt would be better
alright well Im just gonna do a restart and see if that helps at all

its still telling me that zsnes is unavailable but is referred to by another package, it means that the package is either missing, obsolete, or only available from another source. Package zsnes has no installation candidate :(
http://ubuntu.secs.oakland.edu/pool/universe/z/zsnes/zsnes_1.510-2ubuntu1_i386.deb
thanks :) do I just double click it?
probably
thanks :)
oh thats odd.... when I double click it it opens up and then says Status: ERROR: WRONG ARCHITECTURE 'i386'
aww, you're a 64-bit user... sorry... no zsnes for you.. you'll have to compile it
aw damnit hahaha. I never get to do things the easy way!
you'll have to compile it... try this forum post  http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=588744&highlight=dfreer+zsnes
or, as mentioned, install 32-bit ubuntu
I'll try the compile option first haha
